intro: Asterolasia hexapetala, commonly known as the six-petaled asterolasia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. Asterolasia hexapetala is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endemic species.
